channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: An anniversary for great justice: Remembering “All Your Base” 20 years later
item.description: Back in our day, memes didn’t benefit from centralized services like YouTube, Twitter.

item.title: Posing as Amazon seller, consumer group investigates fake-review industry
item.description: Fake Amazon reviews still sold in bulk—it costs $10,900 for 1,000 reviews.

item.title: Microsoft releases new all-in-one Office app for iPads
item.description: The all-in-one iPhone app made a seamless transition to the iPad.

item.title: Today’s best tech deals: Hitman 3, 400GB microSD cards, and more
item.description: Dealmaster also has Apple’s MagSafe Charger, Roku streamers, and gaming laptops.

item.title: North Dakota lawmakers jump into Apple/Epic fight with new app store bill
item.description: ND bill would require Apple, Google to let you side-load apps and avoid the 30% cut.

item.title: “ShareIt” Android app with over a billion downloads is a security nightmare
item.description: Trend Micro audited one of Android’s most popular file-sharing apps. It’s not good.

item.title: North Korea may have hacked into Pfizer servers looking for COVID data
item.description: South Korea’s NIS warned lawmakers of Russian and North Korean hacking activity.

item.title: Bitcoin’s price rises to $50,000 as mainstream institutions hop on
item.description: Bank of New York Mellon says it will begin offering bitcoin storage services.

item.title: PC versions of Grand Theft Auto reverse-engineered to raw source code
item.description: Decompilation leads to Switch port, improved load times, and more.

item.title: Morphing bodywork among Lotus’ ideas for a future electric race car
item.description: The firm has extrapolated current technology out to 2030.

item.title: Galaxy S21 Ultra—$200 cheaper but still not competitive
item.description: Review: The first new 2021 phone doesn’t justify its price.

item.title: Just as a Falcon 9 rocket was due to land, the horizon began to glow
item.description: “We did get a little bright glow… no longer see a flame there.”

item.title: China targets rare earth export curbs to hobble US defense industry
item.description: Beijing asks industry executives if proposed restrictions will harm western contractors.

item.title: Valheim is the endless Viking survival game we have craved for years
item.description: Vikings, voxels, and valor: Why we’re hooked on Steam’s newest Early Access success.

item.title: New type of supply-chain attack hit Apple, Microsoft and 33 other companies
item.description: Researcher who got targets to automatically install his code gets $130,000 payout.

item.title: Neanderthals used stone tool tech once considered exclusive to Homo sapiens
item.description: A child’s molar from an Israeli cave links Neanderthals to the cave’s stone tools.

item.title: VLC 4.0 sneak peek—a look at its work-in-progress new interface
item.description: VLC 4.0’s brand-new interface abstracts media files away from their content.

item.title: Parler says it’s back without “Big Tech” after being kicked off Amazon
item.description: Parler said it’s using “independent technology” to get online after Amazon ban.

item.title: Texas’ power grid crumples under the cold
item.description: Competition for natural gas and frozen wind turbines are only some of the problems.

item.title: Astronomers: A comet fragment, not an asteroid, killed off the dinosaurs
item.description: Jupiter’s gravity pushed comet toward Sun; comet was ripped apart by tidal forces.

item.title: Ebola outbreak erupts in Guinea as cases tick up in the DRC
item.description: The two outbreaks are not linked, but they face the same challenges.

item.title: Zuckerberg responds to Apple’s privacy policies: “We need to inflict pain”
item.description: Meeting between Zuckerberg, Cook “resulted in a tense standoff.”

item.title: After the failure of the Facebook Phone, get ready for a Facebook Watch
item.description: Facebook has an extremely optimistic plan to beat Apple and Google.

item.title: Report: Nissan shot down Apple deal to avoid becoming Foxconn of cars
item.description: Nissan says it wants to “adapt their services to our product, not vice versa.”

item.title: Jaguar to lose internal combustion engines in new EV strategy
item.description: Jaguar will be EV-only from 2025; Land Rover will be 60 percent BEV.

item.title: Chevrolet gives the Bolt EV a facelift, a stretch, and a price cut
item.description: There are new front seats, and the 2022 Bolt EV starts at $31,995.

item.title: Jared Leto’s Joker is back in new trailer for Zack Snyder’s Justice League
item.description: “If you can’t bring down the charging bull, then don’t wave the red cape at it.”

item.title: CDC releases updated “science based” school guidelines
item.description: CDC head Walensky promises the new guidance is “free from political meddling.”

item.title: Why did the flywheel hybrid system never catch on for road cars?
item.description: Born for but never raced in F1, the idea found some success at Le Mans.

item.title: The $3,000 eVscope makes stargazing easy and fun
item.description: Unistellar’s eVscope promises great stargazing whether you’re in the city or country.

item.title: A curious observer’s guide to quantum mechanics, Pt. 6: Two quantum spooks
item.description: Proof that the world can be much stranger than we expect.

item.title: The digital divide is giving American churches hell
item.description: COVID-19 has upended churchgoing in the US, and the impacts are not felt equally.

item.title: Review: The Stand starts out strong and then whiffs the landing
item.description: A stellar cast can’t save the narrative from slowly unraveling into a pointless finale.

item.title: China refused to hand over key data to WHO team probing pandemic’s origin
item.description: The WHO and investigators offer conflicting accounts of the closely watched probe.

item.title: The best Presidents’ Day tech deals we can find this weekend
item.description: Dealmaster has discounts on AirPods Pro, Lenovo and HP laptops, and more.

item.title: New details emerge about Google’s payments to link to French news sites
item.description: The deal could become a template across Europe and perhaps around the world.

item.title: Bad Girls: Grindhouse chills, thrills, and kills shot on a $16K budget
item.description: Three teenage strippers go on a blood-soaked and drug-fueled cross-country tear.

item.title: Prosecutor charges former phone company employee in SIM-swap scheme
item.description: Charges filed as soaring cryptocurrency prices drive increase in SIM swapping crimes.

item.title: Carjackings are up—and gig workers are getting victimized
item.description: Opportunistic thieves lie in wait when drivers leave their cars running.

item.title: A Windows Defender vulnerability lurked undetected for 12 years
item.description: Microsoft patched the bug in its A/V program after researchers spotted it last fall.

item.title: Nvidia wants to buy CPU designer Arm—Qualcomm is not happy about it
item.description: The proposed deal creates a nest of potential conflicts of interest.

item.title: State lawmakers override veto, become first in nation to tax online ads
item.description: First-of-its-kind bill in the US is likely to face legal challenges.

item.title: Report: NASA’s only realistic path for humans on Mars is nuclear propulsion
item.description: “It’s the kind of technology challenge that NASA was built for.”

item.title: Frontier raises sneaky “Internet Infrastructure Surcharge” from $4 to $7
item.description: Fee covers Frontier’s basic network costs but isn’t included in advertised rates.

item.title: Kombucha tea is trendy, but it has also inspired new “living materials”
item.description: “Syn-SCOBY” with genetically tailored yeasts can sense pollutants, purify water

item.title: Open source video player VLC will get a new UI this year with 4.0 launch
item.description: A Web version is also in the works.

item.title: Facebook has been helping law enforcement identify Capitol rioters
item.description: Facebook says it is “continuing to share more information with law enforcement.”

item.title: Adding arthritis drug to current COVID treatment cuts deaths even more
item.description: It’s not a smash hit, but the benefits and the clear results are welcome.

item.title: New Xiaomi smartphone has an extra screen in… uh, the camera bump?
item.description: Leaked hands-on video shows off Xiaomi’s curious new display location.

item.title: CD Projekt Red source code reportedly sells for millions in dark Web auction [Updated]
item.description: Cyberpunk developer refused to pay up after exposure to ransomware attack.

item.title: Listen to haunting notes from an 18,000-year-old conch shell trumpet
item.description: Archaeologists in 1931 assumed the shell was only a broken drinking cup.

item.title: White House hastens to address global chip shortage
item.description: Dearth of semiconductors has forced several US car plants to halt production.

item.title: AT&T scrambles to install fiber for 90-year-old after his viral WSJ ad
item.description: From 3Mbps DSL to 300Mbps fiber: Aaron Epstein’s newspaper ad gets amazing result.

item.title: Microsoft is seeing a big spike in Web shell use
item.description: Spike shows just how useful and hard to detect these simple programs can be.

item.title: The games of love: our favorite couch co-op games to play with a partner
item.description: We pick a few games to enjoy with another, whether they’re a newbie or hardcore.

item.title: Rocket Report: Iran debuts new booster, SpaceX to launch Lunar Gateway
item.description: “Customer demand has been extremely strong.”

item.title: What happens when you replace a human gene with its Neanderthal version?
item.description: Neural stem cells with the Neanderthal version of a key gene behave differently.
